Orem.Provo West Co-op:
== Provo West Cooperative Mercantile Institution ==
The Provo West Cooperative Mercantile Institution is a historic building located in Provo, Utah. It is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Built to encourage trading among the Latter Day Saints, the Provo West Co-op was one of the first stores built in the city under the cooperative merchandising movement sponsored by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints of the late 1800s.
